com.apriori.concurrent.scheduler

Interface TaskDefinition<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of value returned upon completion of the task
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ScheduledTaskDefinition<V>

    public interface TaskDefinition<V>
    The definition for a task that will be executed by a ScheduledTaskManager. This includes several configuration options that are not possible using a normal ScheduledExecutorService.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  TaskDefinition.Builder<V>
      A builder for configuring TaskDefinition instances.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The default maximum history size.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MAX_HISTORY_SIZE

        static final int DEFAULT_MAX_HISTORY_SIZE
        The default maximum history size.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • task

        TaskImplementation<V> task()
        Returns the implementation of the task.
        Returns:
        the task implementation

      • initialDelay

        long initialDelay(TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the delay, in the specified unit, from the time the task is submitted to the time the first instance of the task should be invoked. A negative or zero delay means that it should be executed immediately.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit of the returned value
        Returns:
        the delay between the time the task is submitted for execution and the time that the first instance of the task is scheduled to start

      • isRepeating

        boolean isRepeating()
        Returns whether or not this is a repeating task vs. a one-time task. A task is a one-time task if its ScheduleNextTaskPolicy is ScheduleNextTaskPolicies.NEVER. Otherwise, it is considered a repeating task. Repeating tasks will also have a non-null Rescheduler.
        Returns:
        true if this is a repeating task; false otherwise

      • rescheduler

        Rescheduler<? super V> rescheduler()

      • isFixedRate

        boolean isFixedRate()
        Returns whether or not a repeating task is scheduled based on a fixed rate or with fixed delays between invocations.
        Returns:
        true if this is a repeating task and it is scheduled based on a fixed rate; false otherwise

      • periodDelay

        long periodDelay(TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the period (for fixed rate tasks) or delay (for fixed delay tasks) for this task. If this is not a repeating task, zero is returned. If this is a repeating task and this method returns zero, then a custom Rescheduler is in use and the period or delay between invocations isn't known.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit of the returned value
        Returns:
        the period or delay, in the specified unit, for this task or zero if this is not a repeating task or if the period or delay of the current Rescheduler is unknown

      • scheduleNextTaskPolicy

        ScheduleNextTaskPolicy<? super V> scheduleNextTaskPolicy()
        Returns the ScheduleNextTaskPolicy for this repeating task. If this task is not a repeating task, this returns ScheduleNextTaskPolicies.NEVER.
        Returns:
        the ScheduleNextTaskPolicy for this task

      • maxHistorySize

        int maxHistorySize()
        Returns the maximum size of invocation history to maintain for this task. This is the maximum size of the collection returned by ScheduledTaskDefinition.history() upon scheduling this task definition. If the task repeats more times than this size, information for older invocations is dropped.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of invocation history

      • listeners

        Set<ScheduledTaskListener<? super V>> listeners()
        Returns the set of listeners for this task. These objects are notified upon completion (including failures/abnormal completions) of each invocation of the task.

        The set of listeners can actually be changed after the task definition has been scheduled using ScheduledTaskDefinition.addListener(ScheduledTaskListener) and ScheduledTaskDefinition.removeListener(ScheduledTaskListener).

        Returns:
        the set of listeners for this task

      • uncaughtExceptionHandler

        Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler uncaughtExceptionHandler()
        Returns the Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler for this task. If any invocation throws an uncaught exception, this handler will be dispatched to handle it. If the tasks's handler is never assigned (i.e. null) then the thread's default handler is used.
        Returns:
        the UncaughtExceptionHandler for this task
        See Also:
        Thread.getUncaughtExceptionHandler()
